description: Classic Ruy Lopez development focusing on flexible piece placement and kingside safety.

comments.0: White grabs central space and prepares rapid development.
comments.4: The bishop pins the c6-knight, pressuring e5.
comments.10: Re1 supports the e-pawn and hints at d4.
comments.15: Both sides complete development and castle for safety.

description: Aggressive Sicilian Dragon structure highlighting opposite-side castling attacks.

comments.0: The Dragon often arises after 1...c5 and ...g6.
comments.12: White builds the Yugoslav Attack pawn chain.
comments.19: Black strikes in the center with ...d5.

description: Fundamental Queen's Gambit Declined structure emphasizing harmony and timing.

comments.0: White offers the Queen's Gambit to challenge d5.
comments.6: Pinning the knight increases pressure on d5.
comments.12: White places the rook behind the c-pawn before advancing.
comments.18: Black expands on the queenside with tempo.

description: Plans in a hanging-pawn structure after the Orthodox Queen's Gambit middlegame.

comments.0: White castles and prepares central tension.
comments.1: Black advances the hanging pawns with ...c5.
comments.6: a4 undermines the queenside pawn chain.

description: Demonstrates the classic queenside minority attack in the Carlsbad structure.

comments.0: White solidifies the queenside before launching the pawn minority.
comments.2: Pieces coordinate behind the b-pawn push.
comments.6: Central files are occupied to meet ...e5 breaks.

description: Fundamental king-and-pawn endgame highlighting opposition and triangulation.

comments.0: Activate the king toward the pawn.
comments.4: The breakthrough e4+ forces the opposing king back.

description: Simple rook endgame showing how to escort a passed pawn with the rook.

comments.0: Check the enemy king away before advancing.
comments.4: Centralizing the rook forces the king back.

description: Active calculation exercise featuring a classic knight fork against queen and rook.

comments.0: White captures to open the c-file and target d5.
comments.4: Rd1 piles on the pinned knight.

description: Illustrates how to increase pressure on a pinned piece and convert it tactically.

comments.0: Castle before launching operations on the pinned knight.
comments.2: Central rooks intensify pressure on the e-file.
comments.6: Tactical liquidation leaves Black with structural weaknesses.

description: Extended king-and-pawn technique that highlights triangulation, zugzwang, and precise king manoeuvres.

comments.0: Bring the king forward to support the passer.
comments.10: The breakthrough check forces the opposing king backward.
comments.17: After queening, precise checks herd the king into a mating net.

description: A classic bishop sacrifice on h7 that snowballs into a decisive mating attack.

comments.0: The Greek Gift sacrifice drags the king into the open.
comments.4: Qf3 switches the queen to the h-file with tempo.
comments.8: g4 undermines the pinned bishop and opens the mating net.
